intro: Mattiastrum scabridum, commonly known as the rough mattiastrum, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it a distinctive texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Mattiastrum scabridum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its unique appearance and adaptability to various soil conditions.
